dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3844715X] DMCA. Copyright violation
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Templatemonster Antipiracy Department
[mailto:piracy@templatemonster.com] 
Sent: Monday, April 23, 2007 1:59 AM
To: DMCA
Subject: Re: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3844715X] DMCA. Copyright violation.

Dear Sirs,
 
My previous message contains all the required materials that apply to
DMCA requirements.
 
I attached the official form complain (PDF file) to this e-mail too.  

Thank you.
-- 
Best regards,
Ryan Cathcart
Legal assistant
Artvertex, Inc.
Tel: 15183124162
Fax: 19175913014
mailto:piracy@templatemonster.com

Friday, April 20, 2007, 6:57:38 PM, you wrote:

> To Whom It May Concern:

> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does
not
> substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
> Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
> claim.

> Please visit our web site at
>
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
> nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
>  
> Legal Response Team
> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
> Sent: Monday, April 16, 2007 10:34 PM
> To: DMCA
> Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3844715X] DMCA. Copyright violation.

> ==== Forwarded Ticket ====
> 1. DMCA. Copyright violation.
> Added by system at Tuesday, Apr 17 2007 03:33 am 
> X-MailFrom: piracy@templatemonster.com 
> X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net 
> Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for
> <abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net>; Tue Apr 17 03:33:52 2007

-0000

-0000

> smtp01.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); 
>   Tue, 17 Apr 2007 03:33:48 -0500 
> Return-path: <piracy@templatemonster.com> 
> Delivery-date: Tue, 17 Apr 2007 03:33:48 -0500 
> Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180]
> helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) 
>  by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from piracy@templatemonster.com) 
>  with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) 
>  (Exim) 
>         id 1Hdj8F-0000H2-Dm; Tue, 17 Apr 2007 03:33:48 -0500 
> Received: from mail.templatemonster.com ([66.98.212.112]) 
>         by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from
> piracy@templatemonster.com) 
>         with esmtp (Exim)

> Date: Tue, 17 Apr 2007 11:35:49 +0300 
> From: Templatemonster Antipiracy Department
<piracy@templatemonster.com>

> X-Mailer: The Bat! (v3.60.07) Professional 
> Reply-To: Templatemonster Antipiracy Department rcpt
> <piracy@templatemonster.com> 
> Organization: TemplateMonster.com 
> X-Priority: 3 (Normal) 
> Message-ID: <703002499.20070417113549@templatemonster.com> 
> To: copyright@theplanet.com, abuse@theplanet.com 
> Subject: DMCA. Copyright violation. 
> MIME-Version: 1.0 
> Content-Type: multipart/mixed; 
>  boundary="----------1715F24C2398EAA7" 
> Received-SPF: pass (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: domain of
> templatemonster.com designates 66.98.212.112 as permitted sender)
> client-ip=66.98.212.112; envelope-from=piracy@templatemonster.com;
> helo=mail.templatemonster.com; 
> X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Apr 2007 08:33:48.0572 (UTC)
> FILETIME=[1EBC45C0:01C780CB] 

>  (multipart/mixed) 
> MIME element (text/plain) 
> To whom it may concern 
>  
> Dear Sirs, 
>  
> As the legal assistant of Templatemonster.com project, I am instructed

> to provide you with the following DMCA report. 
> We received the piracy report that lead to
> http://www.allfreetemplates.org website. 
>  
> It has come to our attention that your or one of your customer's 
> servers IP address (70.87.162.130), is involved in a grave situation 
> of unauthorized intellectual and graphic property distribution. 
>  
> http://www.allfreetemplates.org WEB site distributes stolen web design

> materials. These publications have no license support documentation 
> from the design owning company and general website content confirms 
> malicious intent against our company. 
> The exact placement of infringement is: 
>
http://www.allfreetemplates.org/monster-templates-tm-oscommerce-template
> s/  
>  
> These threads contain recompiled sources which were ripped from the 
> original pre-view pages at http://TemplateMonster.com website. All of
> the stolen 
> source numbers (they usually start the topic from words TM) correspond
> to the official products numeration. 
> We direct your attention to the fact of massive publications that 
> violate the copyrights of all major web design vendors such as
boxedArt 
> and DesignLoad. 
>  
> Because of the obvious Templatemonster products distribution, 
> we direct your attention to the terms of our company's License 
> Agreement (http://www.templatemonster.com/terms.php) which clearly 
> prohibits the reselling of our products by any potential or current
> customer. 
>  
> Our website clearly states "Website pages content copyright - 
> 2002-2005 Artvertex, Inc." The permission of  information 
> publishing actions from your server is illegal. Templatemonster.com
> website 
> content cannot be reproduced, copied, or edited in any manner or
medium
> and is therefore making 
> you the possessor of illegal material. US copyright laws protect all
> parts of this material. 
> The owner of this website has been notified of his actions, and has
been
> informed of the 
> consequences. He ignored a feedback request confirming that his site 
> is illegal and has failed the amicable case solution. 
>  
> Hence, we demand the immediate removal of
> http://www.allfreetemplates.org  account from 
> your company server and the cease of distribution of any of our
products
> IMMEDIATELY. 
> We have already notified our corporate lawyers of this situation and
we 
> will not hesitate to exercise our legal right to pursue this matter in
a
> court of 
> law should you fail to meet our demand immediately. 
>  
> Templatemonster.com is committed to investigating licensing
infractions
> not 
> only to protect our own interests but to protect those of the
designers
> who submit their 
> designs to us as well. We are contractually obliged to protect the
> intellectual property rights 
> and livelihood of the artists whose work we license. While we support
> freedom of expression, we 
> must enforce our licensing conditions rigorously in order to meet our
> responsibilities. We 
> feel that your cooperation regarding this matter is fully warranted,
and
> expect it will be 
> promptly forthcoming. 
>  
> Thank you and waiting for your prompt answer. 
> ---- 
> Very truly yours, 
> Ryan Cathcart 
> Legal assistant 
> Artvertex, Inc. 
> Tel:  15183208716 
> FAX:  19175913014 
> mailto:piracy@templatemonster.com 
>  
> note: DMCA form complain and screenshot attached. 
>
